question: Which command is the last command to be raised by the Indian army?
explanation: The Indian Army has a regimental system. It is operationally and geographically divided into 7 commands, with the basic field formation being a division. They are Southern Command ? Pune, Maharashtra; Northern Command ? Udhampur,Jammu & Kashmir ; Western Command ? Chandimandir, Punjab; Eastern Command ? Kolkata ; Central Command ? Lucknow ; Training command ? Mhow, Madhya Pradesh ; South Western Command ? Jaipur. Each Command is headed by Lt. General. The latest command to be setup is South Western Command which is headquartered at Jaipur.
